subject: Technology
title: The James Webb Space Telescope
description: A fast breakdown of The James Webb Space Telescope for builders.

hook.text: Hubble sees visible light. Webb sees infrared, letting it peer through dust clouds into the birth of stars.

buildup.text: Webb launched in 2021 after decades of delays and a budget that ballooned from $1 billion to $10 billion.

discovery.text: Its mirror is six times larger than Hubble's but folds up to fit inside a rocket, then unfolds in space.

twist.text: Webb orbits a million miles from Earth. If anything breaks, no astronaut can reach it to fix it.

climax.text: Its first images showed galaxies formed just 300 million years after the Big Bang. The oldest light ever seen.

punchline.text: Webb doesn't just look at stars. It looks at the beginning of time.

quiz.question: What can the James Webb telescope see that Hubble cannot?
options: Infrared light, revealing objects hidden by dust
The surface of the Moon in detail
